segment.text: I started playing my games because of people like Jenna.
Middle school was cruel, full of disgusting, stinking children.
Hardly a place for the likes of me, but nobody ever did a thing about it.
The thing that set me off at first was her hair;
it was long and shiny and blonde.
Every time somebody spoke to her,
she tossed it over her shoulder,
rivers of gold streaming down her back.
Practically taunting me and my scissors.
After a few weeks of the friendly-game, I was no longer “weird”.
So when I invited her over to play a game with me,
when I chopped it all off with messy, rough snips.
I remember her straw-hair wound tightly around her neck;
and putting a match to the boyish mess
that was the rest of her hair... beauty.
Want to play a game with me?
There are only a few rules.
Oh, and third, I always win.
but with each breath more water entered.
He choked and convulsed in the water.
His fingers closed around his own throat
as he struggled in the water.
His instinct made him go for one last breath.
I say coming out of the bathroom.
I say sticking my tongue out at her.
We both walk out laughing, our arms linked at the elbows.
The boys roll their eyes at us and we both just smile.
and wrap my arms arond him.
She laughs and her and Eaden start off towards our morning class.
“That’s ‘cause if I left it up to you,
we’d never part and we’d get nothing done!”
wraping my arm around his waist
as I start after Sofia and Eaden.
The penguin ran to the shore and dove into the water.
he swam me to the shore
and plopped me down onto the ground.
I awoke to his beak touching mine.
I woke for the second time in an igloo, but not mine.
Then I saw him in the kitchen.
“Yeah I am, but who are you?”
“I just want to know your name.”
then his whole body became dead weight.
and he fell to the ground.
I killed the penguin of my dreams.
It took me such a long time,
but everything has finally fallen into place.
The memories I had of him were all memories of when we were going out,
All I had now were memories.
Every memory I had only caused me pain to think about.
How could you not think about it
if it was what made you happy?
If it was the best few months of your life,
Oh, and what sucked the most?
The ring he gave me for my last birthday?
Sure, I tried to take it off.
I went a good three seconds before hyperventilating
and putting it back on my finger.
I needed to just forget him,
Without him, I felt so wrong!
Every memory that once made me smile now caused the pain in my chest.
This was surely not healthy for me.
A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 1
A warm day with not too much humidity and just enough wind.
The full moon, the half moon, the moon in wax, the moon in wane.... the moon, basically.
Friendships that annoy the hell out of you
but you know will work out.
Having a bedroom all to yourself.
Good food, and plenty of it!
Wrapped in a warm, fluffy quilt.
A backpack with your initials embroidered on it.
Let the emotion emanate from within you.
A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 2
A whole page of cursive writing that looks so cool!!
The crunch of leaves under your feet
as you walk through the woods.
Sunglasses that fall off your face
A necklace with your name on it.
Curled up on the couch on a rainy day.
An evening out on the town.
An evening at home chatting up a storm on AIM .
Blasting the rock and roll so loud that everyone within a ten yard radius can hear it
and catch your tears in something...a box, a hat, a bag.
A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 3
Being corny and cheesy and old-fashioned
Not quite being there yet, but getting there.
and let a little bit drizzle out at a time—not all at once.
ANYTHING that makes you LAUGH OUT LOUD .
Self-esteem.... be it low or high.
A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 4
Fling your arms over your head and SCREAM .
Running like hell from nothing and toward nothing...
A good story to tell your children.
Singing, even when it sounds terrible!
but having someone to drive you to school.
Being hopelessly pale and not caring!
when you win a card game.
DAMN that was difficult... but worth it!!
A long hand-written letter from a friend.
A short note from a close friend.
A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 5
My god, if you think about it, the human body is just INCREDIBLE .
I mean... the nervous system, the digestive system, the cardiovascular system... BIG WORDS !!
What the hell did you just say?
The sound of the rain on the roof!
A beautiful sunset...with reds and golds and blues and purples and.... Rainbows!
or life is yours to miss.
No other road, no other way.......
-thanks to Jonathon Larson for the final quote
The path veered to the right.
and peddled harder up the hill through the tall grass and flowers.
and clapped my feet on the ground to stop my momentum.
I suddenly regretted not getting a haircut
when my mom told me to.
What am I trying to prove anyway?
My mind flinched back against this remark.
I swung my legs over the seat
and let the bike fall to the ground.
Standing there silently I was forced to reflect on that very question.
What are you trying to prove?
I don’t want to be famous.
That is a very good question.
The Lights Go On at Night: Adrift
Seth’s lungs were totally still as he gazed out on the tapestry of stars and planets outside the window.
He felt the windows – extremely thick plastic-type material to keep out the vacuum.
and Abbey was going into shock.
She collapsed back on the floor,
but as he leaned over her,
something hit him in the back of the head.
there was nothing else to do.
as the cone molded to her mouth,
and she settled down to a comfortable peace.
he could use some of that right about now.
Or Calvin, still crying by the foyer stairs.
and gathered him close, fear and confusion
So many mixed emotions – so utterly strange.
Suddenly a warbling chatter echoed from the ceiling.
Then it morphed into a human-like voice.
I remember the overpowering sense of loneliness and sadness and grief.
I wanted to hurt him, to make him suffer
I wanted to kill him, too.
how scared I was of these feelings, of how I had forced myself to stay calm.
But now, as I look back,
Her nose, her freckles, her eyes.
At night, I think of her smile.
And the way the smile lit up your whole face.
It was like the sun coming out from behind a dark, gloomy cloud.
Not just for my family, but for me.
Because I wouldn’t last a second thinking about her.
Oh, the darkness, coming down to relinquish me of my pain.
Tears streamed down a cloudy sky hailing out on whoever stood between them and the ground.
Mrs. Madam was the most un-delighted of all.
grabbing the stares of a passerby.
She gave him a nasty look
He scurried out of her furious strutting pace down the sidewalk.
the affect her temper paired with her ugly face
The mouse on her shoulder plugged his sensitive ears.
She pounded up the stone steps to a sagging, rundown, grafeteed, doorway
In it’s center was a knocker in the shape of Mrs. Madam’s ugly face.
Mrs. Madam smiled vainly at the likeness.
The smile shrank to a pout
the archway held no shelter from the torrent.
but she hated with a burning passion
what to do by a mouse.
I thought of other things, of home.
I played a song in my head, one
that I'd heard on the radio.
Focusing all of my concentration on the song,
I started singing and humming parts of it aloud.
Somewhere faraway, Karon was saying something to me,
but didn’t listen attention to any of it.
It probably looked a little funny,
him trying to talk to me.
After only a minute or two of it, I stopped.
I heard scrawling on a notebook,
He said this with a sort of astonishment,
He'd had to have been planning this"¦ had to have known
I would have reacted the way
Not many people could control their thoughts
unless something were at stake, and even then, many people couldn't.
Nothing was at stake for them.
Their minds were a refuge, a retreat.
Karon was still writing down notes,
scratching the pencil heavily in the notebook.
flicking the light off on his way.
When I woke up, Theo was still there.
I still had a killer headache.
"Can you keep an eye on him for me?"
he came in here a couple of times,
Now I'm starting to wish"¦ forget it."
He wouldn't have understood until later.
At the top of the hill, I veered south.
I really didn’t want to return home and face Adelle.
I had never been to this part before,
and so I had no clue
Miles and miles of them, which seemed to stretch on for much longer than that.
My throat tightened at the scene.
and not from the cold, I walked my bike through the tall grasses,
not quite sure where I was headed.
I was programmed to be scared.
What was this, some kind of outburst of mechanical difficulties?
The wind blew smoothly over my face
as I dropped my bike to the ground
and lifted my face to the pure white clouds above me.
Not any of that Gianna nonsense.
This is what everyone was meant for.
One where there wasn’t any choosing,
and there most definitely wasn’t any fame.
"Hey, I don't really want to stay in here.
can we go to my room instead?"
"Why do you want me to go with you so badly?"
Everyone around here either knows everything
how what he'd said answered my question or not,
as he walked down to his room.
before we'd even opened the door.
but didn't muffle out everything else.
Somebody was sitting in the room,
beating his hands against a book to the rhythm of the song.
pulled me over to the beds against the side of the wall.
and curled up against his pillow,
Once the song ended, no more started up.
making a soft sound to help distract myself.
but soon, I was asleep again.
trying to get back to my dream.
I heard him shuffle out of the room,
Pretty soon after they'd gone, someone else entered.
Doctor Karon pulled something out of his pocket
and turned it on with a click.
He pointed the little flashlight, at least,
it was, into both of my eyes,
He jotted down something on his paper,
and pulled another instrument out of his pocket.
"He was poking your eye with a...
a needle or something, I think.
but there's nothing to be sorry about.
"He can't do that to you again."
"He's going to get away with everything.
he's going to do it, as much as I don't want him to.
I woke up in Spencer's arms.
He smiled down at me sweetly
like it was minutes from serious bruising.
"It's so great to hear your voice.
I saw you in Robert's car
and so I came to the rescue.
You went out a couple minutes in
He ran off about thirty minutes ago
"Us is just how I like it."
"It's all going to be okay, Grace.
It's all going to be okay."
and maybe, he was trying to convince both of us.
Sooner or later, he's going to get tired of rescuing me from Robert and then "¦ well,
For now though, I'm content right here in his arms, far away from Robert.
Having an amazing time was no problem, considering the fact
that Jared and I had a lot in common.
if my favorite ficlet author wrote a sequel to his story.
and had a ton of new friend requests from people in school.
Jared was online and I decided to check his profile,
that I was already on his top..
if I had fun and all that day.
when he suddenly replied “Hey, why arent i first on your top?”
Well, i did have other friends
Plus, I just met him right?
putting me on his top so quickly,
asking to hang out with me again.
because i was already invited by other people.
as a circuit in my arm sparked.
sparing only a glance for my robotic arm.
I stood there for a moment,
Staring out at the open fields
it was possible to be free.
and most of all free from Gianna.
The wind insisted on punching me in the face,
My super fast reflexes could do that.
I peddled fast and fast and fast.
I told him to calm down, it wasnt that big of a deal.
We could hang out any other day,
and told me to have fun.
not trying to ruin tomorrows fun.
he met me at the door.
In homeroom, he and i were surrounded by conversations in all directions.
how popular I’d become so quickly.
Jared was sitting next to me
I constantly tried to get into the conversations
like i had to keep up an appearance around him.
After school, me and the group I was with lounged at the the local cafe
and had TONS of fun, especially with Jueli.
I felt bad for leaving Jared though.
He was pretty nice to me yesterday on my first day.
The extent of love can never be reached...
so of course we have to reach it!
A good romp in the park with your dog!
Oops, now my clothes are covered in dog hair.
Collecting random articles for absolutely no reason.
Flipping pennies over so the head is face-up.... just
so someone else can get lucky.
Finding a quarter on the ground...I’M RICH !!
Hell, there’s news at all hours of the day!
Argh my fingers are red and frozen!
THANK THE STARS for air conditioning!
Darn it where’s the sun screen?
Going out of your way to step on a crunchy-looking leaf.
The sun doesn’t go away just because it’s a cloudy day!
Melody sat up high in a tree,
grieving again for the loss of her trainer, Jayden.
He had been attacked by people
Melody had watched it all happen,
and she ran back to Jayden.
and there wasn’t anything she could do about it.
her tears falling through the branches,
splashing silently into the earth beneath the tree,
sobbing for the loss of her trainer.
He had beenteaching her tai kwon do,
so she could learn more self defense.
but that didn’t stop the pain of losing a best friend.
her face buried in her knees,
tucked up close to her chest,
“So, you’ll pray to Saint Anthony for me?”
she asks for the billionth time,
as your hand lingers over the door knob.
You have been idling in her foyer for the past three minutes
while you find excuses to not say goodbye to one another.
Despite an extensive search of her bedroom, during which she uncovers her middle school yearbook
(you laugh at her frizzy hair and braces;
it shut), a lacy black bra
(which she quickly hides away in a drawer, cheeks furiously pink), and twenty dollars (to her delight),
her diamond earring is still missing.
After promising to spend the rest of the day
praying to the Patron Saint of Lost Things
that at least she has one earring left.
some things are meant to be a pair.”
One day, the irony may very well kill you.
wiping the tears from her face,
She climbed up to a clearing
in the branches to get a better view of what was happening.
He was running insanely quickly from two men, probably around their mid thirties.
they were armed by the way
their clothes moved over places like their ankles or their chests.
Melody was not only gifted with various talents such as stealth, the ability to move silently, invisibly and extremely quickly,
She climbed down from the tree,
using her stealth power to get next to the boy,
He looked over at her, surprised.
you were the only one with certain"¦ talents?"
that the men were catching up.
and they've been following me since then,"?
"Well why don't we give them a slip,"?
veering invisibly off to the left.
The two men came to a halt,
Melody and the boy could still see each other, in a sort of mirror world of the regular one.
The mirror world was much slower than the real world,
which is why they moved so much faster when cloaked by their abilities.
when traveling in the mirror realm,
if anyone in the real world was able to see them.
Melody eyed him suspiciously at the question.
She looked over at the two thugs,
She walked over to where they had been standing, to make sure
disappearing and reappearing in the real world.
and walked over to Owen, now at regular speed.
"So, you have the gift of stealth too,"?
"The ability to be able to go into that mirror realm... run really fast.
she had these powers all her life,
